org.pcc.pams.math

Class Vector2d

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pcc.pams.math.Vector2d

  • public class Vector2d
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a 2D vector.

    Information is stored internally as cartesian coordinates, but they can be converted to polar coordinates through functions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Vector2d NULL
      The null vector (0, 0).
      double x
      The x coordinate.
      double y
      The y coordinate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector2d(double x, double y)
      Creates a new vector with the specified coordinates.

      Checks if two vectors have the same coordinates.

      Returns a version of this vector with a different angle.

      Returns a version of this vector with a different norm.

      Calculates and returns the norm (or radius) of the vector.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        public static final Vector2d NULL
        The null vector (0, 0).

      • x

        public double x
        The x coordinate.

      • y

        public double y
        The y coordinate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector2d

        public Vector2d(double x,
                double y)
        Creates a new vector with the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal coordinate.
        y - The vertical coordinate.

    • Method Detail

      • angle

        public double angle()
        Calculates and returns the polar coordinates' angle.
        Returns:
        The vector's angle.

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(double newAngle)
        Changes the vector's direction by modifying its angle. Internally converts polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates to achieve this.
        Parameters:
        newAngle - The new angle of the vector's direction.

      • norm

        public double norm()
        Calculates and returns the norm (or radius) of the vector. If comparing against another norm, it is computationally less expensive to use norm2().
        Returns:
        The vector's norm.

      • norm2

        public double norm2()
        Calculates and returns the square of the norm (or radius) of the vector. This is faster than calculating the norm itself.
        Returns:
        The square of the vector's norm.

      • setNorm

        public void setNorm(double newNorm)
        Sets the norm to a new value. Internally converts polar coordinates to cartesian coordinates to achieve this.
        Parameters:
        newNorm - The new value of the norm.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Vector2d otherVector)
        Checks if two vectors have the same coordinates.
        Parameters:
        otherVector - The other vector to check against.
        Returns:
        True if both of their coordinates are equal, false otherwise.

      • scalar

        public double scalar(Vector2d otherVector)
        Returns the scalar product of this vector and another one.
        Parameters:
        otherVector - The vector to multiply with.
        Returns:
        The scalar product of the two vectors' coordinates.

      • sum

        public Vector2d sum(Vector2d otherVector)
        Returns a vector that is the sum of this vector and otherVector. Does not change this vector's value.
        Parameters:
        otherVector - The other vector to use for the sum.
        Returns:
        A vector whose coordinates are the sum of this vector and otherVector.

      • sub

        public Vector2d sub(Vector2d otherVector)
        Returns a vector that is the difference of this vector and otherVector. Does not change this vector's value.
        Parameters:
        otherVector - The other vector to use for the difference.
        Returns:
        A vector whose coordinates are the difference of this vector and otherVector.

      • product

        public Vector2d product(double k)
        Returns a vector that is the product of this vector and a scalar. Does not change this vector's value.
        Parameters:
        k - The scalar to multiply by.
        Returns:
        A vector whose coordinates are the product of this vector's coordinates and k.

      • getNormed

        public Vector2d getNormed(double newNorm)
        Returns a version of this vector with a different norm. Can be used to create a "truncated" or "stretched" vector. Does not change this vector's value.
        Parameters:
        newNorm - The new norm to apply.
        Returns:
        A vector with the same direction but the new norm.

      • getAngled

        public Vector2d getAngled(double newAngle)
        Returns a version of this vector with a different angle. Can be used to create a "rotated" vector. Does not change this vector's value.
        Parameters:
        newAngle - The new angle to apply.
        Returns:
        A vector with the same norm but the new direction.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a simple representation of the vector, in cartesian coordinates.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string characterizing the vector.
